meanings.definition: An additional cost or expense incurred in the production of goods or services.
meanings.sent1: The oncost of shipping materials added to the overall price of the product.
meanings.sent2: The company calculated the oncost of labor before setting the selling price.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected oncost of raw materials made the accountant's eyes widen.
meanings.sent4: The oncost of delays in production can be detrimental to the business.
meanings.sent5: The oncost of quality control ensures customer satisfaction.

meanings.definition: To add a cost or expense to the production of goods or services.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to oncost the new machinery to improve efficiency.
meanings.sent2: It is important to carefully oncost any additional expenses to avoid losses.
meanings.sent3: The manager had to oncost the budget to accommodate unexpected expenses.
meanings.sent4: The decision to oncost the project with extra features pleased the clients.
meanings.sent5: To oncost wisely is crucial for the financial health of the business.
